tools: (a) any {@item artisan's tools|PHB} or (b) {@item gaming set|PHB}

default: (a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) two {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) five {@item javelin|phb|javelins} or (b) any {@filter simple melee weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=sand}
(a) a {@item explorer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item scholar's pack|phb}
(a) {@item scale mail|PHB} or (b) {@item leather armor|PHB}, {@item shortbow|PHB}, and {@item Arrows (20)|PHB|20 arrows}

classFeature.name: Grand Pursuits
entries: In the pursuit of knowledge, you find yourself immersed in the teachings of others. You make Intelligence checks at Advantage while in the presence of your mentor. Copying your mentor's notes take half of the time required for a coherent copy.

entries.name: Mentors
entries: Mentors take the roles of spies, researchers, deans, scholars, and sometimes magic users such as wizards. Mentors have the stats of a {@creature Commoner|MM} if used directly in the game. Talk to your Dungeon Master for personalization and implementation into the setting.

classFeature.name: Tool Expertise
entries: You keep your mind busy in your personal time. You can add double your proficiency to one of your Tool Sets.
You can double your proficiency for another Tool Set at 8th level.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 2nd level, you adopt a style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: By the time you reach 2nd level, you have learned to use the magical essence of the arcane to cast spells, much as a wizard does. See Spells Rules for the general rules of spellcasting and the Spells Listing for the {@filter votarist spell list|spells|class=Votarist (Vot)}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know one cantrip of your choice from the votarist spell list. You learn additional votarist cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Votarist table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Votarist table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your votarist spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell catapult|XGE} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell catapult|XGE} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-level or Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the {@filter votarist spell list|spells|class=Votarist (Vot)}.

The Spells Known column of the Votarist table shows when you learn more votarist spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your votarist spells, since your magic draws on your knowledge of the arcane. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a votarist spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

classFeature.name: Votary Creed
entries: At 3rd level, you choose a Creed that you strive to serve. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 11th, 15th, and 20th level.

classFeature.name: Arcane Infliction
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal force damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The extra damage is {@dice 1d4} for a 1st-level spell slot, plus {@dice 1d4} for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of {@dice 5d4}. You can roll a 1d6 to inflict one of the following conditions upon a failed Wisdom Save using your Spell save DC. This effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Inflection
entries: At 6th level, your studies and disciplines have been marked by your personality. Choose one of the following options.
You choose one additional Inflection at 10th level.

classFeature.name: Grand Pursuit Improvement
entries: As you excel in your studies, you find yourself an expert in one of your studies. You double your proficiency in one of your skills.

classFeature.name: Creed Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Votarist Creed.

classFeature.name: Creed Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Votarist Creed.

classFeature.name: Creed Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Votarist Creed.

classFeature.name: Creed Feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature granted by your Votarist Creed.

classFeature.name: Extra Tool Expertise
entries: At 8th level, you can double your proficiency for another set of {@item artisan's tools|PHB}.

classFeature.name: Inflection Improvement
entries: At 10th level, you choose one additional {@filter Inflection|optionalfeatures|feature type=V:I}

classFeature.name: Minor Breakthrough
entries: At 14th level, your arcane studies have brought you to new possibilities. You can learn one spell from the {@filter wizard spell list of 4th-level or lower|spells|level=0;1;2;3;4|class=Wizard}, on top of learning a spell from the {@filter votarist spell list|spells|class=Votarist (Vot)}

classFeature.name: Major Breakthrough
entries: At 18th level, you can learn two additional spells from the {@filter wizard's spell list of 6th level or lower|spells|level=0;1;2;3;4;5;6|class=Wizard}, on top of learning two spells from the {@filter votarist spell list|spells|class=Votarist (Vot)}.

condition.name: Glamoured
entries: When a creature is glamoured, any spell attacks have advantage against them as well as suffering disadvantage against the next spell requiring a saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Grim Methods
entries: You become proficient in {@skill Intimidation} checks. If you are already proficient, double your profiency bonus. {@spell Tongues} can be cast as a ritual spell in the process of interrogation of a creature.

optionalfeature.name: Finders' Practice
entries: Upon using the {@spell locate object} spell, you can upcast it to 3rd level for several effects: your search range is increased to 1 mile, you can determine if it is moving or stationary, and you can determine its whereabouts within 100 feet, even with a lead covering not exceeding 1/2" in thickness. For every level above 3rd, you can add an additional 1/4" in the lead covering that no longer hides the object within 100 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Silent Routine
entries: If you upcast {@spell silence} to 3rd level you can choose up to 2 creatures within its area to be not affected by the spell. For every level above 3rd, you can choose one additional creature. Additionally, you become proficient in {@skill Stealth}.

optionalfeature.name: Diverse Studies
entries: Choose one {@filter cantrip, 1st, 2nd, and 3rd level spell from another spellcasting class's list|spells|level=0;1;2;3|class=!Votarist (Vot)}. Your spellcasting ability for these spells depends on the spell list you chose from: Charisma for bard, sorcerer, and warlock; Wisdom for cleric or druid; or Intelligence for wizard or artificer.

optionalfeature.name: Signature Studies
entries: Choose one {@filter cantrip, 1st, 2nd, and 3rd level spell from votarist spell list|spells|level=0;1;2;3|class=Votarist (Vot)}. Add your Intelligence modifier to their damage when used against a creature. If the spell chosen uses a spell save, instead add the additional damage only on a failure.

optionalfeature.name: Physical Studies
entries: Add your Intelligence modifier to your damage whenever you use your Arcane Infliction feature. Additionally, if you use your action to use a cantrip and it does not hit, you can make an additional weapon attack as part of your action.

optionalfeature.name: Smart Striker
entries: Once per turn, you can add your Intelligence modifier as additional damage on a weapon hit.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Thinking
entries: Once per short rest, you can use your Intelligence modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier for a Dexterity saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Dangerous Thinking
entries: Once per long rest, you can add your Intelligence modifier to your initiative roll.

optionalfeature.name: Reliable Talent
entries: You can add half of your Intelligence Modifier, rounded down, to any skill checks in which you are not proficient.

subclassFeature.name: Creed of the Protectors
entries: Protectors are the first and last lines of defence for their masters. Often seen as bodyguards or sworn protectors, they excel in the martial and arcane prowess of defending others as well as themselves.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Defender
entries: At 3rd level, you can perform the somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a shield in one or both hands. Additionally, you can choose either your weapon or shield to act as a spellcasting focus. You can change your spellcasting focus over the course of a short rest.
If you have an item or feature that already makes your weapon a spellcasting focus, you can treat all attacks made with it as magical if it is not already magical.

subclassFeature.name: Creed Spells
entries: You gain votarist spells at the votarist levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian from Afar
entries: At 7th level, you can use your reaction to cast {@spell shield} on a creature within 30 feet that you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Sentry
entries: At 11th level, you add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) to your passive {@skill Perception} and you cannot be surprised.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Retaliation
entries: At 15th level, you are always under the effect of the {@spell absorb elements} spell as if cast at 1st level. This effect can only be used on the first hit against you per round. You regain the use of this feature at the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Grand Bulwark
entries: At 20th level, as an action, you cast {@spell armor of Agathys} at 5th level without expending a spell slot. Hostile creatures within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell save DC or be compelled to attack you. Additionally, if the {@spell armor of Agathys} is destroyed, it will instead be reduced to 1 hit point for the remainder of the minute.
In addition, your Eldritch Retaliation feature will be used to the full effect of the spell, instead of for the first hit.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Creed of the Inquisitors
entries: Inquisitors seek out answers to their questions given by their masters. All answers are sought with the same intensity whether that question is the location of materials, teachings, or potential threats.

subclassFeature.name: Creed Spells
entries: You gain votarist spells at the votarist levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Novitiate
entries: At 3rd level, you can add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) to any {@skill Insight}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Persuasion} check equal to your proficiency bonus. You must declare this before rolling. You must complete a long rest to regain any expended uses.

subclassFeature.name: Surveyor's Senses
entries: At 7th level, you can expend a spell slot to gain advantage on any {@skill Perception} or {@skill Investigation} check.

subclassFeature.name: Method of Inquiry
entries: At 11th level, choose one of the following options.

subclassFeature.name: Inflicted Words
entries: At 15th level, you can use your Arcane Inlictions as a touch spell. Those under the infliction have disadvantage on Charisma and Wisdom saves against spells and actions used in determining information, such as {@spell zone of truth} for 1 minute. You can choose whether the infliction does damage to the creature or not.

subclassFeature.name: Master Inquisitor
entries: At 20th level, no one can match you in your pursuit of answers. For 10 minutes, all skills are considered proficient and all {@skill Investigation} and {@skill Perception} checks that roll a 9 or lower on the {@dice d20} can be treated as a 10.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Creed of the Apprentices
entries: Apprentices are those who have undivided attention for their studies under their masters. Unmatched in their studies of both martial and magical abilities, many have fallen against their universal application of their skills.

subclassFeature.name: Creed Spells
entries: You gain votarist spells at the votarist levels listed.

entries.caption: Apprentice Spells
rows: {@spell guards and wards}, {@spell Otiluke's freezing sphere}

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Transcripts
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to copy wizard spells from the Abjuration, Enchantment, Transmutation, and Illusion schools. The spells that you add to your spellbook as you gain levels reflect the arcane research you conduct on your own, as well as intellectual breakthroughs you have had about the nature of the multiverse. You might find other spells during your adventures. You could discover a spell recorded on a scroll in an evil wizard's chest, for example, or in a dusty tome in an ancient library.

entries.name: Copying a Spell into the Book
entries: When you find a {@filter wizard spell of 1st level or higher|spells|class=Wizard|level=!0}, you can add it to your spellbook if it is of a spell level you can prepare and if you can spare the time to decipher and copy it.

Copying that spell into your spellbook involves reproducing the basic form of the spell, then deciphering the unique system of notation used by the wizard who wrote it. You must practice the spell until you understand the sounds or gestures required, then transcribe it into your spellbook using your own notation.

For each level of the spell, the process takes 2 days and costs 200 gp. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it. Once you have spent this time and money, you can prepare the spell just like your other spells.

subclassFeature.name: Inflictions Improvement
entries: At 7th level, your Arcane Inflictions changes from using {@dice 1d4} for using a 1st level spell slot to using a {@dice 1d6} and using an additional {@dice 1d6} per spell level above 1st.
This further improves at 15th level, where you can choose which condition to apply to the hit creature.

subclassFeature.name: Inflictions Improvement
entries: At 15th level, you can choose which condition to apply to the hit creature.

subclassFeature.name: Intense Studies
entries: At 11th level, choose one of the following options:

subclassFeature.name: Prodigy
entries: At 20th level, you are a master of your studies. For a minute, choose one concentration spell to cast at its original level. You automatically succeed any Constitution checks made to maintain concentration.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Votarist
entries: Drawing his Longsword, a human intercepts the intruder's blade. With a quick glance back to his mentor, he places himself in harm's way. Retaliating with a strike that mysteriously blinds his target, he brings his blade in a point towards the enemy numbers, muttering arcane words to rend them apart.

A lithe Gnome approaches the restrained cultist with determination in her eyes, ready to pry every secret from her quarry. Using quick jabs, gentle queries, and subtle magics to make all questions answered.
One cocky, fiery Genasi thows a bolt of flame at the raging Minotaur. Without a moment of upset in its miss, he brings his Warhammer against the monster's chest.

Votarists are the learners of all things, finding answers to all their questions in the forms of allies, foes, dungeons, and of course their teachers. They pursue the secrets of the world, usually in the company of fellow researchers and sometimes adventurers.

entries.name: Obsessed with Learning
entries: A Votarist is consumed by their desire for knowledge of all manners. Usually accompanied by a mentor or sent out by a College or school in pursuit of practical and sometimes arcane learning.

Votarists train for years to learn the skills of combat, mastering a variety of weapons and armor. Even so, their martial skills are secondary to the magical power they wield: power to disorient their foes, to glean more from their surroundings, and to even protect the teachings of their age and ages before.

entries.name: Pursuits beyond the Schools
entries: Votarists are usually sent out in protection of a teacher or mentor associated with their education, temple, or school. Taking up a Creed to further their usefulness to their mentors and fellow colleagues brings them closer to their arcane potential.
They acknowledge the efforts of others in their daily lives; understanding that there are small wonders in the mundane that still bring knowledge further in their own ways.

entries.name: Making a Votarist
entries: The biggest question to answer when making a Votarist is what they wish to accomplish in their learning. Are they looking to support their mentor's hypothesis or their own on an arcane, philosophical, or practical topic? Are they looking for long lost knowledge of the Weave or natures of secret gods? Are they looking for the ancient enemies of their pursuits, aiming to find and destroy or seal away forbidden knowledge?

How did you find yourself in these pursuits? Did a wizard acknowledge your potential? Were you a bodyguard that was given further knowledge upon discovering your curiosity? Were you originally on the path to be a fighter until a College sought you out for your enlistment?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a votarist quickly by following these suggestions. First, Strength should be your highest ability score, followed by Intelligence. Second, choose the {@background sage} background.
